metadata.Title: CVE-2017-2906 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
An exploitable integer overflow exists in the animation playingfunctionality of the Blender open-source 3d creation suite version 2.78c. Aspecially created '.avi' file can cause an integer overflow resulting in abuffer overflow which can allow for code execution under the context of theapplication. An attacker can convince a user to use the file as an asset inorder to trigger this vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-2906` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

blender - 2.79+dfsg0-1
blender-data - 2.79+dfsg0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: blender package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.79+dfsg0-1').
